item.title: Report E-2024020078
item.description:
Report E-2024020078

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: FORT DODGE
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XFO experienced a UN3082 Caromax 28 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 3’ x 2’ area of the wooden trailer floor and a 1’ x 1’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a crack in the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (2) 55- gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024020083
item.description:
Report E-2024020083

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 31, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 fell in transit and released approximately one (1) liter of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the corrosive liquid-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024010075
item.description:
Report X-2024010075

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-06T18:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-23
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12-23-2023 a CN transportation employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom outlet valve cap during routing work operations at the CN Waterloo Yard in Waterloo, IA. The employee notified the Yard Supervisor who then initiated an emergency response from the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The responding DG Officer observed liquid dripping from the BOV cap which was found to be tool tight (could not turn by hand). The shipper's security seal was not found. BOV handle was in the fully closed position. It was determined that there was a failure in the sealing surface of the valve seat to include a defective or missing BOV gasket. The BOV handle was cycled several times from the closed to open position to ensure there was no foreign material trapped in the valve seat that would prevent a proper seal. The cap was then removed, and the valve was monitored for 10 minutes for any continued leakage. There was no longer any leakage from the valve at this point. An inspection of the BOV cap gasket was performed and revealed it to be very stiff allowing the product to leak past the gasket. The BOV gasket was replaced, and the cap re-installed utilizing a 24" pipe wrench.
